titleStmt.title: An exact relation of the whole proceedings of gallant Col. Mitton in North-Wales, as is assured under the hands of severall commanders of note. The besieging of Carnarvin, Denbigh, Flint, and Holt Castles: and propositions of conditions for the surrendring of Anglesey Island; with an account of those garisons not yet besieged. Also, a narration of the perticular of a letter from Plymouth, of the state of Pendennis, and the surrender of Salcumb, called Charles-fort, to Colo. Welden, by Sir Edward Fortescue.

An exact relation of the whole proceedings of gallant Col. Mitton in North-Wales, as is assured under the hands of severall commanders of note. The besieging of Carnarvin, Denbigh, Flint, and Holt Castles: and propositions of conditions for the surrendring of Anglesey Island; with an account of those garisons not yet besieged. Also, a narration of the perticular of a letter from Plymouth, of the state of Pendennis, and the surrender of Salcumb, called Charles-fort, to Colo. Welden, by Sir Edward Fortescue.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
